<analysis>
Based on the roadway markings visible in the later frames (especially frames 4 and 5), the white Volvo ahead is straddling a lane whose painted arrow clearly has both a “straight” component and a “left‐turn” branch. Although there is a “no U‐turn” sign (the large circular sign with a hooked arrow crossed out), there is no sign or marking prohibiting left turns from this middle lane. In the final two frames, you can see multiple arrows on the pavement: the leftmost lane has a dedicated left‐turn arrow; the lane the ego (and the white Volvo) occupy has that split arrow indicating left‐turn‐or‐straight; and lanes further right continue straight or right. Hence the correct answer is that this lane allows both going straight and making a left turn.
</analysis>

<answer>C</answer>
